The Breakthrough Therapy designation directs the expedited development and review of products that can provide substantial improvement over available therapy, which expands the benefits that patients experience over prior treatments.
19 Products approved in 2020 that were granted a Breakthrough Therapy designation include avapritinib for patients with gastrointestinal stromal tumor, and nintedanib for patients with chronic fibrosing interstitial lung diseases. There was a cumulative total of 156 approvals for all products given the Breakthrough Therapy designation by CDER through December 2019.
